e. coli.gloss: a species of bacterium normally present in intestinal tract of humans and other animals

ec.gloss: an international organization of European countries formed after World War II to reduce trade barriers and increase cooperation among its members

ecballium elaterium.gloss: Mediterranean vine having oblong fruit that when ripe expels its seeds and juice violently when touched

ecc.gloss: (telecommunication) a coding system that incorporates extra parity bits in order to detect errors

eccentric.gloss: conspicuously or grossly unconventional or unusual

eccentric person.gloss: a person with an unusual or odd personality

eccles.gloss: Australian physiologist noted for his research on the conduction of impulses by nerve cells (1903-1997)

ecclesiastes.gloss: an Old Testament book consisting of reflections on the vanity of human life

ecclesiastic.gloss: of or associated with a church (especially a Christian Church)

ecclesiastical attire.gloss: attire that is appropriate to wear in a church

ecclesiastical benefice.gloss: an endowed church office giving income to its holder

ecclesiastical calendar.gloss: a calendar of the Christian year indicating the dates of fasts and festivals

ecclesiastical law.gloss: the body of codified laws governing the affairs of a Christian church

ecclesiastical mode.gloss: any of a system of modes used in Gregorian chants up until 1600

ecclesiastical robe.gloss: attire that is appropriate to wear in a church

ecclesiasticus.gloss: an Apocryphal book mainly of maxims (resembling Proverbs in that respect)

synonyms.word: wisdom of jesus the son of sirach

eccm.gloss: electronic warfare undertaken to insure effective friendly use of the electromagnetic spectrum in spite of the enemy's use of electronic warfare

eccyesis.gloss: pregnancy resulting from gestation elsewhere than in the uterus

ecdysiast.gloss: a performer who provides erotic entertainment by undressing to music

ecdysis.gloss: periodic shedding of the cuticle in arthropods or the outer skin in reptiles

ecesis.gloss: (ecology) the process by which a plant or animal becomes established in a new habitat

ecf.gloss: liquid containing proteins and electrolytes including the liquid in blood plasma and interstitial fluid

ecg.gloss: a graphical recording of the cardiac cycle produced by an electrocardiograph

echeneididae.gloss: fishes having a sucking disk on the head for clinging to other fishes and to ships

echeneis.gloss: type genus of the Echeneididae: typical remoras

echidna.gloss: a burrowing monotreme mammal covered with spines and having a long snout and claws for hunting ants and termites

echidnophaga gallinacea.gloss: parasitic on especially the heads of chickens

echinacea.gloss: small genus of North American coarse perennial herbs

echinocactus.gloss: any cactus of the genus Echinocactus

echinocactus grusonii.gloss: large cactus of east central Mexico having golden to pale yellow flowers and spines

echinocereus.gloss: large genus of low-growing shrubby ribbed cacti of Mexico and southwestern United States

echinochloa.gloss: annual or perennial succulent grasses of warm regions

echinochloa frumentacea.gloss: coarse annual grass cultivated in Japan and southeastern Asia for its edible seeds and for forage

echinodermata.gloss: radially symmetrical marine invertebrates including e.g. starfish and sea urchins and sea cucumbers

echinops.gloss: genus of Mediterranean and Eurasian herbs: globe thistles

echinus esculentus.gloss: a sea urchin that can be eaten

echium.gloss: a genus of bristly herbs and shrubs of the family Boraginaceae

echium vulgare.gloss: a coarse prickly European weed with spikes of blue flowers

echo sounder.gloss: a measuring instrument that sends out an acoustic pulse in water and measures distances in terms of the time for the echo of the pulse to return

echo sounding.gloss: determining the location of something by measuring the time it takes for an echo to return from it

echogram.gloss: an image of a structure that is produced by ultrasonography (reflections of high-frequency sound waves)

echography.gloss: using the reflections of high-frequency sound waves to construct an image of a body organ (a sonogram)

echolocation.gloss: determining the location of something by measuring the time it takes for an echo to return from it

eck.gloss: a German Roman Catholic theologian who was an indefatigable opponent of Martin Luther (1486-1543)

eckhart.gloss: German Roman Catholic theologian and mystic (1260-1327)

eclectic.gloss: someone who selects according to the eclectic method

eclectic method.gloss: making decisions on the basis of what seems best instead of following some single doctrine or style

eclecticism.gloss: making decisions on the basis of what seems best instead of following some single doctrine or style

eclecticist.gloss: someone who selects according to the eclectic method

eclipse.gloss: cause an eclipse of (a celestial body) by intervention

eclipsis.gloss: omission or suppression of parts of words or sentences

eclogue.gloss: a short poem descriptive of rural or pastoral life

ecm.gloss: electronic warfare undertaken to prevent or reduce an enemy's effective use of the electromagnetic spectrum

eco-warfare.gloss: violence carried out to further the political or social objectives of the environmentalists

ecological niche.gloss: (ecology) the status of an organism within its environment and community (affecting its survival as a species)

ecological succession.gloss: (ecology) the gradual and orderly process of change in an ecosystem brought about by the progressive replacement of one community by another until a stable climax is established

ecological terrorism.gloss: violence carried out to further the political or social objectives of the environmentalists

ecological warfare.gloss: violence carried out to further the political or social objectives of the environmentalists

ecology.gloss: the branch of biology concerned with the relations between organisms and their environment

econometrician.gloss: an economist who uses statistical and mathematical methods

econometrist.gloss: an economist who uses statistical and mathematical methods

economic aid.gloss: gift of money or other material help to support a person or cause

economic and social council.gloss: a permanent council of the United Nations

economic and social council commission.gloss: a commission of the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations

economic assistance.gloss: gift of money or other material help to support a person or cause

economic consumption.gloss: (economics) the utilization of economic goods to satisfy needs or in manufacturing

economic crisis.gloss: a long-term economic state characterized by unemployment and low prices and low levels of trade and investment

economic expert.gloss: an expert in the science of economics

economic rent.gloss: the return derived from cultivated land in excess of that derived from the poorest land cultivated under similar conditions

economic science.gloss: the branch of social science that deals with the production and distribution and consumption of goods and services and their management

economic system.gloss: the system of production and distribution and consumption

economic value.gloss: the amount (of money or goods or services) that is considered to be a fair equivalent for something else

economics.gloss: the branch of social science that deals with the production and distribution and consumption of goods and services and their management

economics department.gloss: the academic department responsible for teaching and research in economics

economiser.gloss: a frugal person who limits spending and avoids waste

economist.gloss: an expert in the science of economics

economy.gloss: the system of production and distribution and consumption
frugality in the expenditure of money or resources

economy class.gloss: a class of accommodations on a ship or train or plane that are less expensive than first class accommodations

ecosoc.gloss: a permanent council of the United Nations

ecosoc commission.gloss: a commission of the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations

ecoterrorism.gloss: violence carried out to further the political or social objectives of the environmentalists

ecrevisse.gloss: tiny lobster-like crustaceans usually boiled briefly
small crayfish of Europe and Asia and western North America

ecstasy.gloss: a state of being carried away by overwhelming emotion

ecstatic state.gloss: a trance induced by intense religious devotion

ect.gloss: the administration of a strong electric current that passes through the brain to induce convulsions and coma

ectasia.gloss: dilatation or distension of a hollow organ

ectasis.gloss: dilatation or distension of a hollow organ

ectoprocta.gloss: coextensive with or a subphylum of Bryozoa

ectotherm.gloss: an animal whose body temperature varies with the temperature of its surroundings

ecuador.gloss: a republic in northwestern South America

ecuadoran.gloss: a native or inhabitant of Ecuador

ecuadorian.gloss: a native or inhabitant of Ecuador

ecumenicalism.gloss: (Christianity) the doctrine of the ecumenical movement that promotes cooperation and better understanding among different religious denominations: aimed at universal Christian unity
